00020 namespace boost {
00021 namespace xint {
00022 
00024 namespace detail {
00025 
00026 void sqrt(base_integer& target, const base_integer& nn) {
00027     if (nn._is_zero()) { target._attach(nn); return; }
00028     if (nn._get_negative()) throw exceptions::cannot_represent("library cannot "
00029         "represent imaginary values (tried to take sqrt of negative number)");
00030 
00031     // A naive implementation using pure integers can result in an endless loop,
00032     // cycling between two numbers that are approximately correct (try
00033     // sqrt(23)). To deal with that, we multiply everything by an even power of
00034     // two.
00035     const size_t extra_bits = 1;
00036 
00037     integer n(nn._to_integer());
00038     n <<= (extra_bits * 2);
00039 
00040     // Initial guess is half the length of n, in bits
00041     integer guess;
00042     setbit(guess, n._log2()/2);
00043 
00044     // Now refine it until we're as close as we can get.
00045     while (1) {
00046         integer guess2=(guess + (n / guess)) >> 1;
00047         if ((guess >> extra_bits) == (guess2 >> extra_bits)) break;
00048         guess = guess2;
00049     }
00050 
00051     // Remove half of the added bits.
00052     guess >>= extra_bits;
00053     target._attach(guess);
00054 }
00055 
00056 } // namespace detail
00058 
00071 integer sqrt(const integer& n) {
00072     integer r;
00073     detail::sqrt(r, n);
00074     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r);
00075 }
00076 
00077 } // namespace xint
00078 } // namespace boost
